reviews.title: Medieval times birthday celebration
text: We went for my daughters 23rd birthday and had a fantastic time. There was so much food we couldn't finish it all. It was delicious. The show was exciting and you really get involved cheering on your knight. We had so much fun we look forward to our next celebration there.

reviews.title: BEST WAY TO SPEND A 40TH WEDDING ANIVERSARY EVENING  OUT
text: the show was great, story lines and action was as good as could be with out anyone actually getting hurt. only criticision would be parking at event . frustrating to get back out of parking (heavy traffic and confusion)

reviews.title: Total amazing experience
text: An enchanting evening of frivolity with an amazing show. The actors were amazing  but the actors using hero’s of the show are the horses they are marvellous and looked to truly enjoy their work. Also the falcon was amazing and gave an amazing aerial show.

reviews.title: Excellent Night Out
text: Great for family, celebrations or just to have a good time.  Food is great and plentiful.  Food served hot and cooked lovely.  The castle is gorgeous inside.  Plenty to see from the horses on their stalls, the falcons, the gift shops etc. The queues were good and well organized.  Service was great.  The arena show itself was very well done.  Cheering and booing by all when the Knights started the games.  Cannot say enough about much fun we had with our relatives who were visiting from England.   Easy access from the Exhibition GO Station.  About an 8 min walk.

reviews.title: Medieval Times
text: Excellent experience. A bit expensive,  but for a great family event. For all ages. There isn't anything that compares.

reviews.title: Good show, terrible food
text: Show/entertainment was good. Servers were very nice, but food was inedible. For the price it’s not worth it. This has ruined my experience. This was my 5th time here.l (and probably the last). The food has gotten worse each visit but this was by far the worst. My entire group of 10 people all felt the same way. The soup was good but it was room temperature which I was not a fan of as I like my soup warm. My father’s chicken came raw (twice) but the third one was cooked. The chicken quality was terrible and could not chew it. It came with 1 dried out wedge of potato and dried out corn. We upgraded for cake but it was not good. The eclairs that came with the meal were ok. We all left hungry though :(. The show itself is good to experience but have low expectations for the food.

reviews.title: Huzzah!
text: We had such a great time here! We're big Renaissance festival fans, so we knew we would enjoy it and dressed up a bit for the experience. Plenty of other people were dressed Medieval-ish too. The earlier you show up, the better your seats seem to be. You do have a bit of a wait beforehand, but there's plenty to see inside. There are also lots of things to buy. The whole show was very entertaining and the food was good. It does seem quite expensive, but afterwards we were quite happy with the value for the money. We even got pictures with our knight afterwards and he signed our crowns. I would definitely return.

reviews.title: Absolutly recomend at least once in your life. Great food, Great show, Great experience.
text: We took my 7 yr olds for a 1PM show.
-Loads of easy parking.
-Great food. (Apreciated the take out box at the end.)
-Great show, my kids absolutly loved it and so did we.
-Souvenir shop was surprisingly fairely priced for most items.

We got there right as the doors opened and got upgrated to VIP which meant our table was in the first row. It was a nice surprise. Great view for the kids however, the way the tables are placed, everyone has a great vue.
I liked the way the layout is. I didn't feel too squished. The servers kind of have their own place to walk around with out needing to disturb the next row.

We booked this show in the afternoon during our "rest day" in our family vacation. It was the only thing that was booked for this day between a water park day and exploring down town Toronto day. As an adult, I just loved how easy and stress free this activity was.

reviews.title: Best first experience
text: Experience was amazing.
Chicken was a bit dry and I wished we had a sauce to dip it in. Other than that we loved every moment.

reviews.title: Wonderful family fun.
text: The show really is great with a good and fun story.  The MC tells is very nicely and it is awesome to see the spectacular showmanship of the knights.  Really beautiful and I highly recommend it.

Things they can do better:  a stronger sound system.  I would have loved to have heard every part of the story that was being told but could not. I asked 2 people around me if they could understand everything (in case I was the problem) and they could not.  I feel my experience would have been way better if I could have heard it all.
One other thing they can improve is seasoning the food.  The soup was delicious, but the chicken lacked flavor.
Overall, a great experience that I recommend.

reviews.title: Medical Times Toronto Good Time
text: Went to the show the animals were beautiful and well trained. The meal was very good especially the soup. The show was entertaining a little staged and timing was off a little.

reviews.title: super night out
text: it was simply magical. it is on the pricey side but worth every penny. staff is cordial and entertaining. our server was funny and engaging . the food was amazing and plentiful. our friend was vegan and she was taken care of  without problems. the show was amazing. our knight didnt win  but it was amazing anyway. for a fun night out or to celebrate definitely worth visiting

reviews.title: Fabulous Family Event
text: We paid the extra to be a part of the Queens Royalty group, giving us front row seats, a clear view of everything and a fabulous picture/folder for everyone in our group.  Although we haven't been here since the late 90's when we brought our kids and celebrated my Dad's 75th birthday, it was wonderful to bring our kids again and watch them enjoy their kids and our grandchildren having such a magical time!  Our granddaughter was even chosen by the Black & White Knight to fight for her!  She was absolutely thrilled at age 7!

reviews.title: Great fun to be had
text: This was an absolutely fantastic experience. Lots of fun, great food and a fab show. We were very well looked after throughout and the show was very entertaining. Would highly recommend for anyone looking to have a fun evening with something a bit different

reviews.title: Night out as a family
text: Dinner and show was great.  Service staff was too notch.   We paid a little extra for the VIP and sat in the red Knight section right in the front front row.  My girls got to interact with the knights as well as being presented with the red knight sash from the queen.

reviews.title: PERFECT DAY
text: Very good show. We were yellow and we won. The tickets are a little pricey but for visitors or first time, I would very highly recommend it. Comes with Dragons Blood soup and more food.

reviews.title: 5* fun family entertainment, worth every cent ⭐️
text: We were in Toronto on our family holiday from the Uk. We have 3 boys aged 5,8 and 13.

We arrived around 715pm for a 730pm showing (we stayed out of town at the Hilton embassy suite and underestimated traffic). The staff were amazing at getting us in quickly, there’s parking on site (about $20). We had our photo taken which us also about $20 which you can get at the end of the show.

Show started promptly at 730, you get given a crown with your ‘colour’ you then can cheer your knight on. We also bought flags to wave $5 each, kids loved these! Our serve Stanley was AMAZING!!! Shout out to Stanley! He came round with drinks and filled our cups up (choice of soft drinks) Myself and my partner let the lady at the front desk know we were vegetarian. We were given a card that was placed at our table. Stanley then have us starters. Soup and garlic bread, it was tasty and kids are it. We had bean stew with corn for our main. The kids had half a chicken each (portions were wildly large) with half a potato and corn.
You don’t get cutlery but lots of hand wipes- keeping it authentic!!

You then get your drinks topped up again. Throughout the show there also a bar server checking in if you want extra drinks from the bar (we don’t drink so didn’t need this but lots of people people drinking having a great time).
Dessert was an eclair. Which again was good. The show lasts 2 hours and there’s a huge gift shop where you can buy loads of themed bits for the kids and it’s not badly priced.

Overall the atmosphere, show itself and food was great. The knights riding the horses also put on a brilliant show and looked like they were having a good time. I was totally shocked by the horses. Amazingly well trained, athletic and extremely healthy looking show ponies.
Would recommend, would go again.

reviews.title: Worth a visit but not outstanding
text: Good food, friendly staff, show a little repetitive and lacklustre.
The fight/jousting routines were very samey, the horses were fab though

reviews.title: Excellent experience with my son!
text: Had an excellent time with my pre-teen son! Such a fun show and the food was great. All staff were very helpful and friendly. Thought I might lose my voice with all the yelling we did. My son has been raving about it since and wants to go back immediately, asking if he can have his birthday there. Definitely a hit!

reviews.title: Unique Experience for Adults and Kids
text: Amazing experience! Well paced and lots of fun. hard to get into the seats, so make sure you go to the bathroom before the show starts. No options for food, but they do cater to dietary restrictions. We had to get the gluten free meal for my daughter and she was thrilled that it was almost exactly the same as ours. Show was fun, atmosphere was great, and the gift shop is very unique and not overpriced.

reviews.title: Great outing for any group.  Fun for all.
text: Lots of fun.  Excellent food.   Very well organized.  Servers helpful and friendly.  Store was excellent and our person was very patient.

reviews.title: Overall great experience!
text: What a great experience. I would recommend paying the extra for the VIP passes. You get seater first, a banner to wave around, food is served first and your seats are at the front. Drinks are included however if you was specialty drinks or alcohol it's and extra charge. The timing of everything keeps the kids entertained and excited. Be prepared to eat with your hands. It is part of the experience. They don't accept cash to purchase any other the extras. Gratuity is not included so do t forget to tip your server at the end!

reviews.title: Hail Red Knight
text: Red Knight selected me as his tournament Queen. My 6yr old grandson was so proud. Good sized portions, too large for small children especially when they are so fixated on watching show. Took home leftovers. Staff very friendly. So cute seeing so many little ones dressed for era attending show. Show hasn't changed much since seeing it some 10+ yrs ago. Will tske my other grandson when he turns 6 in 5 yrs.

reviews.title: My Lords & Ladies
text: Our knight and his guests were welcomed to the castle in true royal style.  We cheered loud and honorably for our black and white Knight.  Our knight fought valiantly and with bravery, and was chosen as the champion of the tournament.

reviews.title: Family Day Fun
text: The experience is wonderful. Very entertaining. The food is good, great portions.
The staff are friendly, professional and helpful. Our Server Ashley was fantastic.
The only downfall is the seating is a little tight when you have 7 people at a table.
Also the drinks and souvenirs are expensive.
I would recommend the upgrades to VIP it is worth it.

reviews.title: Favorite place
text: I come here every time I visit Toronto. By far my favourite place to eat dinner. Always have an incredible time and the food is amazing.

reviews.title: Fun time!
text: This is my first time at the Toronto location. It’s been over 15 years since I went to the one in Schaumburg. Seemed like not much has changed between then and now. We mistakenly booked for the incorrect date not knowing until we got there, but we got extremely lucky and they found a spot for us! It was a bit hectic so we appreciated them squeezing us in. Our server seem to struggle to keep up. We had gotten our chicken and nearly finished when she finally came around with our sides. She was nice and she tried. Chicken was REALLY good! The sides were really good too! The show itself was great and enjoyable! I wish they had one closer to Ohio, but we didn’t mind the 4.5 hour drive up!

reviews.title: Great Couple's Night Out
text: The show was amazing! It's excellent for all ages.
We were entertained throughout the show.
The food was great!
The staff were wonderful.

reviews.title: Wonderful Christmas Gift!!!
text: We had a wonderful time.  We went as a family Christmas gift with Son, his wife and three granddaughters.  Watching the girls joy as they were transported in time was such a gift for us.  The meal was good and the servers and employees were wonderful.  Before we went I thought it was expensive….it was truly worth every penny

reviews.title: Don't waste your hard earned money here
text: Horrible customer service.
Do not cater to kids.
Parking is a disaster when other events going on. Missed portion of show even though i was 1.5hrs ealy. But they don't care, or inform you.
Actors are just there for a paycheck.
Servers made inappropriate comments in front of my young children. And comments demeaning the show. Horse droppings right infront of you while your eating.
You can see better shows in better locations. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

reviews.title: So fun!!
text: Such a great and fun experience for the whole family. We had a great time. The meal serving is huge so plan to come hungry!!

reviews.title: Good time with the family
text: If you’re into medieval jousting and enjoy a couple hours feeling like you’ve travelled back in time - this may be the place for you! Also, who doesn’t like eating food with their hands

reviews.title: Great Show, Great Meal
text: It's a great show for everyone. The meal is quite good and very generous. All staff are courteous and efficient. A couple of things to consider before going - if you don't want to stand around dodging the very overpriced gift shop, arrive 30 minutes before your show. There is absolutely NOTHING to do once inside the "castle" as the dungeon is closed since covid. You can have a quick peak at some horses through glass and then you listen to the kids whine about all the stuff they don't need in the gift shop. Second, take a cooler if you have a car. There will be food left over if you have kids. The dinner is half a chicken, half a potato, corn, soup, garlic bread and dessert. Should you upgrade to VIP? Same show, same dinner. VIP gets you into the arena first but the show won't start until everyone is seated. You get seated lower but again, there are really no bad seats so being higher up isn't a bad thing. It's not like you're in the nosebleed section, it isn't that bad. We paid $15/person for the VIP upgrade and I don't think I'd do it again. Your choice.

reviews.title: Fun family event
text: Prior to booking online look for a discount code, saves you a bit.  Doors open 1.5 hours before the performance but they do not let you into sit at your table until 15 mins prior to the show starting so you are basically left wandering around the very large gift shop.  Any person who upgrades to VP status is let in first so there is no point in lining up and they ask you not to as you block the doors.  The dinner was good, eaten with your fingers, soup, garlic bread, very large pieces of chicken, potato and corn.  We could not eat it all and the kids picked away at it.  We upgraded to the middle package and it was $7 extra per person, we got a family photo for each person, priority seating and upgraded desert, cake.  Parking is $15.  Kids enjoyed it.  The only downside was the drive in and out of Toronto!!

reviews.title: First visit to Medieval Times
text: I was really impressed with the combat choreography. Our server did an excellent gollum impression! I would definitely like to visit again when I am in the city.

reviews.title: You have to go
text: Amazing experience food was great ! Go early get a drink with cup (extra ) but worth it ! Tip your waitress they do a great job

reviews.title: Amazing time every time
text: Amazing place amazing show great good great showe from dressage to tournament, service was also amazing and very prompt and super filling will defiantly not go hungry and they are accommodating to all dirty needs and restrictions; well done

reviews.title: A Nice But one Time Experience
text: Entertaining show but it dragged on a little too long. Food and service was average at best. Don’t get sucked into paying for the VIP tickets as there is little to no difference. Certainly not worth the extra.

reviews.title: Medieval Times Dinner & Tournament
text: My BF took me there for my birthday. The Show was excellent and the food was supper.
I highly recommend to visit at least once, you get to eat with your hands. The servers are ecellent!

reviews.title: Still going strong…
text: Food is still good. Chicken was moist, corn was great, potatoes were seasoned good.
You get a breast AND a leg!
Kids get ice cream and adults get eclair.
